review: I’m taking folic acid for over 5 years.I realize I have  problem sometimes falling asleep, woke up on the middle of the morning can’t go back to sleep.It doesn’t help me at all. After doing my research on it I realize I have  to stop taking it for my health.
I take this med what it does to me is I have trouble sleeping at night I have restless nights

Over the counter folic acid can sometimes make depression, related to common folate abnormalities, worse!! Or do nothing at all.  Usually, Deplin or another prescription folate is required. ---Insurance companies still won't pay for the prescription versions, saying that over the counter is basically the same!?----It is not.  This needs to change!!  The non-prescription folic acid CAN be helpful for pregnant women. ---It is useless for my condition as my body can't convert it into what I need.

I have some genetic defects pertaining to folate and I read people have had some success with methyfolate so I thought it might help with some of my issues (Depression/anxiety/ADD-PI ). I tried it as a individual vitamin and it made my brain fog worse, and I developed a feeling of being somewhere between tired/fatigued and agitated. I tried lowering the dose but it didn't help. However, for some reason, I have no issues with it intertwined with other vitamins/minerals in a whole food multivitamin....it seems very strange to me, but whatever works.
